subject: global timeout
msgSnippet: Hi, heaving read an article on test categorization (http://www- 128.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-cq10316/index.html?ca=drs-), I want to implement some
messageBody:
Hi,

heaving read an article on test categorization (http://www-
128.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-cq10316/index.html?ca=drs-),
I want to implement some of the ideas for my group. Some of the tests
written by developers are not "true unit tests" as they require
bootstrapping the entire app environemnt in order to run. Needless to
say, they are slow and should be considered component or system tests.
After separating unit tests into a category of their own, I'd like to
make sure that when they are run, each individual tests runs no longer
than a specified timeout value. Specifying the timeout value in @Test
annotation isn't going to cut it for a couple of reasons: 1) don't want
to rely on individual developers to put in a correct value; 2) the
value have to be easily changeable and should be runtime specific.

Is there a way to implement this?


Thanks
D.
